mse/channel.documentation: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic.

mse/channel/name.documentation: Name of the channel. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight).

mse/channel/detector.documentation: Detector description. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight).

mse/channel/detector/geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/centre/r.documentation: Major radius. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

mse/channel/detector/centre/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

mse/channel/detector/centre/z.documentation: Height. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

mse/channel/detector/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/x1_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

mse/channel/detector/x1_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

mse/channel/detector/x1_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x1_unit_vector container: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

mse/channel/detector/x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/x2_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

mse/channel/detector/x2_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

mse/channel/detector/x2_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x2_unit_vector container: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

mse/channel/detector/x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/x3_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

mse/channel/detector/x3_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

mse/channel/detector/x3_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

mse/channel/detector/x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/detector/outline/x1.documentation: Positions along x1 axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

mse/channel/detector/outline/x2.documentation: Positions along x2 axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

mse/channel/detector/surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within detector container: Detector description.

mse/channel/aperture.documentation: Description of a set of collimating apertures. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight).

mse/channel/aperture/geometry_type.documentation: Type of geometry used to describe the surface of the detector or aperture (1:'outline', 2:'circular', 3:'rectangle'). In case of 'outline', the surface is described by an outline of point in a local coordinate system defined by a centre and three unit vectors X1, X2, X3. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. In case of 'circular', the surface is a circle defined by its centre, radius, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3.  In case of 'rectangle', the surface is a rectangle defined by its centre, widths in the X1 and X2 directions, and normal vector oriented towards the plasma X3. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures.

mse/channel/aperture/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures.

mse/channel/aperture/centre/r.documentation: Major radius. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

mse/channel/aperture/centre/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane detector/aperture. This origin is located within the detector/aperture area.

Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the detector/aperture plane and oriented towards the plasma.

mse/channel/aperture/x1_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X1 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures.

mse/channel/aperture/x2_width.documentation: Full width of the aperture in the X2 direction, used only if geometry_type = 3. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures.

mse/channel/aperture/outline.documentation: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures.

mse/channel/aperture/outline/x1.documentation: Positions along x1 axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures. Within outline container: Irregular outline of the detector/aperture in the (X1, X2) coordinate system. Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

mse/channel/aperture/outline/x2.documentation: Positions along x2 axis. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Repeat the first point since this is a closed contour.

mse/channel/aperture/surface.documentation: Surface of the detector/aperture, derived from the above geometric data. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within aperture container: Description of a set of collimating apertures.

mse/channel/line_of_sight.documentation: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight).

mse/channel/line_of_sight/first_point.documentation: Position of the first point. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/first_point/r.documentation: Major radius. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within first_point container: Position of the first point.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/first_point/ph.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within first_point container: Position of the first point.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/first_point/z.documentation: Height. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within first_point container: Position of the first point.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/second_point.documentation: Position of the second point. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/second_point/r.documentation: Major radius. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within second_point container: Position of the second point.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/second_point/p.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within second_point container: Position of the second point.

mse/channel/line_of_sight/second_point/z.documentation: Height. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within line_of_sight container: Description of the line of sight of the channel, given by 2 points. Within second_point container: Position of the second point.

mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution.documentation: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight).

mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution/ce.documentation: Position of the centre of the spatially resolved zone. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse).

Major radius. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within centre container: Position of the centre of the spatially resolved zone.

Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within centre container: Position of the centre of the spatially resolved zone.

Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within centre container: Position of the centre of the spatially resolved zone.

mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution/wi.documentation: Full width of the spatially resolved zone in the R, Z and phi directions. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse).

Major radius. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within width container: Full width of the spatially resolved zone in the R, Z and phi directions.

Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within width container: Full width of the spatially resolved zone in the R, Z and phi directions.

Height. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse). Within width container: Full width of the spatially resolved zone in the R, Z and phi directions.

mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution/ge.documentation: Set of 9 geometric coefficients providing the MSE polarization angle as a function of the local electric and magnetic field components (these are related to the angle between beam and line of sight). The list is ordered as follows : coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER (numerator of the MSE angle expression); coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER, EZ (denominator). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse).

mse/channel/active_spatial_resolution/ti.documentation: Time. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within active_spatial_resolution container: Spatial resolution of the measurement, calculated as a convolution of the atomic smearing, magnetic and beam geometry smearing and detector projection, for a set of time slices (use a single time slice for the whole pulse if the beam and the line of sight are not moving during the pulse).

mse/channel/polarization_angle.documentation: MSE polarization angle. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight).

mse/channel/polarization_angle/data.documentation: Data. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within polarization_angle container: MSE polarization angle.

mse/channel/polarization_angle/validity_.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within polarization_angle container: MSE polarization angle.

mse/channel/polarization_angle/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within polarization_angle container: MSE polarization angle.

mse/channel/polarization_angle/time.documentation: Time. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (lines of sight). Within polarization_angle container: MSE polarization angle.

mse/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic.

mse/time.documentation: Generic time. Within mse IDS: Motional Stark Effect diagnostic.
